snippet: When the first phase of the Second Avenue subway makes its debut in 2016, metal sidewalk grates, the bane of women in pumps, will be noticeably absent.
abstract: First phase of New York City's Second Avenue subway line will make its debut in 2016, and ubiquitous metal sidewalk grates, the bane of women in high heels, will be noticeably absent; air, instead of flowing naturally from grates, will be pumped in and out of mechanical ventilating towers near every air-conditioned station.
lead_paragraph: When the first phase of the Second Avenue subway makes its debut in 2016, metal sidewalk grates, the bane of women in pumps, will be noticeably absent.

headline.seo: Second Ave. Subway Line Won’t Have Sidewalk Ventilation Grates
headline.main: No Heel Hazards (or Gusts) as Subway Expands
headline.print_headline: No Heel Hazards (or Gusts) as Subway Expands
